section.name: Log4JNA 2
section.p: Log4jna is a library of native appenders for log4j 2 TM.
Unlike the native implementation(s) in Log4jTM, this project uses JNA and therefore does not require a native DLL in a system directory or on PATH.
Because Log4jna is intended for the Windows TM event logger it can only be used, and built on Windows TM environments.
Since version 2 Log4jna is built with Maven TM and can be included from Maven Central repository.

p.strong: Please note that despite what the org.apache namespace may suggest, this project is currently not endorsed or sponsored by the Apache Software Foundation.

subsection.name: Windows registry configuration
subsection.p: In order to write to the into Windows TM Event Logger, Log4JNA tests and demo application require some entries in the registry.

dl.dd: This configuration will place the output in the EventViewer under Windows Logs -> Application with a source of Log4JnaTest Open the windows registry and set a key into HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Application\ named Log4jnaTest
Add the following 2 values to the new key

Name: TypesSupported Type: REG_DWORD Data: 0x7
and
Name: CategoryCount Type: REG_DWORD Data: 0x6

subsection.name: Previous version Log4jna 1.3 for Loj4j 1.x
subsection.p: Development on Log4jna for Loj4j 1.x TM has been discontinued.
The latest build can be downloaded here: log4jna-1.3.zip
Except for the sintax of the Log4J TM configuration files, all other configuration requirements described here apply to this version.
